00003 /****************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER:  Threads
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    The purpose of THREADS is to provide support for multithreading. 
00009  *    In order to lock a thread, a mutex can be created, locked and unlocked. 
00010  *
00011  * REUSE NOTES
00012  *
00013  *    Threads is intended for reuse by any application that requires multithreading
00014  *    support.
00015  *     
00016  *
00017  * LICENSES
00018  *
00019  *    None apply to this component.
00020  *
00021  * RESTRICTIONS
00022  *
00023  *    Threads has no restrictions.
00024  *
00025  * ENVIRONMENT
00026  *
00027  *    Threads was tested and certified in the following environments
00028  *
00029  *    1. Solaris 2.7
00030  *    2. Windows XP 
00031  *
00032  * MODIFICATIONS
00033  *
00034  *    Date              Description
00035  *    ----              -----------
00036  *    12-12-05          Original Code
00037  *
00038  */
00039 
00040 
00041 /***************************************************************************/
00042 /*
00043  *                               INCLUDES
00044  */
00045 
00046 #include "threads.h"
00047 
00048 
00049 /***************************************************************************/
00050 /*                              FUNCTIONS                                  */
00051 
00052 
00053         /* Create a mutex */
00054 long Threads_Create_Mutex( Thread_Mutex* _thread_mutex )
00055 {
00056 #ifdef WIN32
00057 
00058                 *_thread_mutex = CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL );
00059                 if( *_thread_mutex )
00060                         return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00061                 else
00062                         return THREADS_CREATE_ERROR;
00063 
00064 #else
00065 
00066                 if( pthread_mutex_init( _thread_mutex, NULL ) )
00067                         return THREADS_CREATE_ERROR;
00068                 else
00069                         return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00070 
00071 #endif
00072 }
00073 
00074 
00075 /* Lock the mutex */
00076 long Threads_Lock_Mutex( Thread_Mutex thread_mutex )
00077 {
00078 #ifdef WIN32
00079 
00080         if( WaitForSingleObject( thread_mutex, INFINITE ) == WAIT_OBJECT_0 )
00081                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00082         else
00083                 return THREADS_LOCK_ERROR;
00084 
00085 #else
00086         if( pthread_mutex_lock( &thread_mutex ) )
00087                 return THREADS_LOCK_ERROR;
00088         else
00089                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00090 #endif
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 /* Unlock the mutex */
00095 long Threads_Unlock_Mutex( Thread_Mutex thread_mutex )
00096 {
00097 #ifdef WIN32
00098         if( ReleaseMutex( thread_mutex ) )
00099                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00100         else
00101                 return THREADS_UNLOCK_ERROR;
00102 #else
00103         if( pthread_mutex_unlock( &thread_mutex ) )
00104                 return THREADS_UNLOCK_ERROR;
00105         else
00106                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00107 #endif
00108 }
00109 
00110 
00111 /* Destroy the mutex */
00112 long Threads_Destroy_Mutex( Thread_Mutex thread_mutex )
00113 {
00114 #ifdef WIN32
00115         if( CloseHandle( thread_mutex ) )
00116                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00117         else
00118                 return THREADS_DESTROY_ERROR;
00119 #else
00120         if( pthread_mutex_destroy( &thread_mutex ) )
00121                 return THREADS_DESTROY_ERROR;
00122         else
00123                 return THREADS_NO_ERROR;
00124 #endif
00125 }
